RelatedPhrase.word: It's a godsend to meet you here

list.key: It's a godsend to meet you here
list.exp: 在这儿看见你我感到惊奇
list.abs: 在天气热的国家可以露天睡觉.I am amazed to see you here.在这儿看见你我感到惊奇。It's a godsend to meet you here.在这遇见你真是喜出外。Your youth and simplicity plead for you in this instance.

derivation.yuyuan_name: early 19th cent.: from God's send 'what God has sent'

entry.tran: 天赐之物；助益匪浅的事物
entry.def: If you describe something as a godsend, you are emphasizing that it helps you very much.

example.ex: Pharmacists are a godsend when you don't feel sick enough to call the doctor.
example.tran: 生病了但不严重、无需求医的时候，药店能帮上大忙。

means.word_mean: 1. a sudden happening that brings good fortune (as a sudden opportunity to make money);

sentences.sentence: "the demand for testing has created a boom for those unregulated laboratories where boxes of specimen jars are processed lik an assembly line"

auth_sentence.content: The money was a godsend, bailing me out.
auth_sentence.res_content: The money was a godsend, bailing me out.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: The money was a godsend, bailing me out.

auth_sentence.content: They are a godsend to Terry Socol of Skokie, Ill.

auth_sentence.content: You are going to be a perfect godsend to us all.
auth_sentence.res_content: You are going to be a perfect godsend to us all.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: You are going to be a perfect godsend to us all.

sentences.en: Her gift of money was a godsend.
sentences.cn: 她送来的钱使人喜出望外。
